System Overview

Roboscope is a digital augmented reality system designed for technicians conducting visual inspections of wind turbine blade shells and other components between infusion and closure.

This revolutionary system transforms traditional manual inspection processes into precise, digital workflows, eliminating the need for manual measurement tools.

What is Roboscope?

Roboscope addresses the critical challenges in wind turbine blade production where inspectors traditionally rely on tape measures, calipers, and paper check-sheets. The system provides:

  • Precise AR-based defect marking and measurement
  • Real-time dimensional capture with spatial coordinates
  • Automated repair instruction generation
  • Centralized engineering portal for data analysis
  • Integration with ERP and MES systems
AR
Augmented Reality Inspection

System Integration

Key Benefits

🎯 Precision Measurement

Captures exact dimensions and spatial coordinates relative to the leading edge and blade root, eliminating measurement errors.

📱 Mobile Integration

Simple smartphone app that operators can use to point at defects for immediate capture and analysis.

🔄 Real-time Processing

On-device computer vision model processes data instantly, with real-time streaming to centralized systems.

📊 Centralized Analytics

Engineering portal provides interactive 3D blade models, filtering capabilities, and comprehensive reporting.

System Startup

Get started with Roboscope by setting up both the mobile application and web portal components.

Mobile App Setup

1

Download App

Download Roboscope from the App Store

2

Request Access Code

Tap "Request code with email" on the main screen

3

Enter Email

Enter your registered email address and tap "Enter" - code will be sent shortly

4

Activate Account

Enter the received code and you'll be redirected to the home screen

Web Portal Setup

1

Access Portal

Navigate to the demo version of the web portal

2

Request Portal Code

Press "Request code" on the login screen

3

Email Verification

Enter your registered email address and tap "Enter" - code will be sent to your email

4

Access Dashboard

Enter the code, press "Go", and you'll be redirected to your inspections list

Note: The demo version allows you to alternate between two roles - Quality Inspector (mobile app) and Engineer (web portal). You can switch between views on the same device if you're the only participant.

Shop Floor Operations

Step-by-step guide for quality inspectors conducting AR-based defect inspections on the shop floor.

👷 Quality Inspector Role

Step 1: Start New Inspection

Action: Launch Roboscope → Tap the + icon → Choose Inspection → Pick part type → Tap Create → Start

Result: Camera screen activates for inspection

Step 2: Place AR Origin

Setup: Start session outside the shell, then walk into the shell with app camera active

Positioning: Go 3-4 meters inside shell, turn around, aim crosshair at bottom of root

Action: Tap "Place Origin"

Result: Three colored axes and blade model appear (model can be hidden via icon)

Critical: Always position the origin at or beyond the blade root for correct spatial references.

Step 3: Mark Defects

Detection: Aim at a fault and tap "Add defect"

Marking: A persistent red rectangle appears → Tap "Save"

Adjustment: Tap-and-hold one finger to resize, two fingers to move

Multiple Markers: You can place multiple markers as needed

Step 4: Annotate & Photograph

Annotation: Tap marker panel → Open form → Select type/depth → Save

Photography: Tap camera icon → Snap high-resolution images → Wait 2-3 seconds for preview

Important: Always create markers "inside" the shell (forward from origin) so that lay-up and repair views work correctly.

Step 5: View Lay-up & Repair

Access: Open marker with depth > 1 → Tap "Layup" to see top X plies

Repair View: Tap "Repair" for grinding layout

Error Handling: If error appears, move marker until it sits within the shell

Step 6: Review & Close

Review: Tap "Defects" (badge) to list or hide all markers

3D View: Tap notepad icon for top-down 3D view (pinch to zoom, two-finger pan)

Finish: Tap "Back to Home" → "Inspections" → Swipe left to delete sessions

Engineering Portal

Web-based dashboard for engineers to analyze inspection data and manage quality control workflows.

👨‍💼 Engineering Office Role

Evaluate Inspection Progress

Access: Sign in using the system startup process

Review: Check inspection sessions → Select inspection → Click defects on map or list

Analysis: View images and data for each marked defect

Demo Note: In the demo version, marker fields are read-only for demonstration purposes.

Export & Integration

Export Functions: Use portal's export function for CSV/PDF logs

Production Features: In real deployments, you can update marker parameters, add notes, and upload reference files

Integration: Data can be streamed to ERP or MES systems via REST API

Data Analysis Features

  • Interactive 3D blade models with defect visualization
  • Filter by defect type, severity, or inspection date
  • Individual record investigation with high-resolution images
  • Consolidated logs for system integration
  • Progress tracking against manufacturing timelines
  • Trend analysis and root-cause investigation tools

Troubleshooting

Common issues and their solutions when working with Roboscope AR inspection system.

AR Tracking Issues

Issue: AR tracking fails or becomes unstable

  • Ensure adequate lighting (≥ 600 lux recommended)
  • Check for reflective surfaces that may interfere with tracking
  • Restart the AR session if tracking becomes inconsistent

System Requirements

Lighting Minimum 600 lux for reliable AR tracking
Device Modern smartphone with ARKit/ARCore support
Space Clear workspace inside blade shell for movement
Network Stable connection for real-time data streaming

5. AR Features & Modes

Core AR Capabilities

Spatial Tracking

Advanced AR tracking maintains precise spatial coordinates relative to blade geometry, ensuring consistent measurements across inspection sessions.

Surface Recognition

Improved sensor sensitivity provides better recognition of surfaces, enabling accurate defect placement even on complex blade geometries.

Haptic Feedback

System provides haptic feedback (screen vibration) when actions are completed successfully, enhancing user experience and confirmation.

Inspection Modes

Two Points Mode

Marker Display: Large sphere visualization for precise placement
Point Adjustment: Move and adjust existing points rather than full replacement
Axis Locking: Lock specific axes (X, Y, Z) while maintaining surface tracking
Surface Snapping: Automatic snapping to detected surfaces for accurate placement
💡

Pro Tip: Direct the crosshair at corner edges (H-points) for perfectly straight and centered marker placement.

Edge Mode (Experimental)

⚠️

Status: Edge Mode is currently experimental and should be treated as a development feature. It may not function consistently in all scenarios.

Purpose: Designed for placing markers specifically along blade edges

Functionality: System attempts to find intended edge surface for marker placement

Limitations: May fail to locate surface in certain conditions

Advanced Features

  • Continuous surface tracking even when axes are locked
  • Real-time coordinate calculation relative to blade root
  • Automatic defect categorization based on visual characteristics
  • Integration with XFMEA risk framework for repair instructions
  • High-resolution image capture with defect overlay annotations

6. Industrial Use Cases

Wind Turbine Manufacturing Applications

Full Mould Grid

AR overlay of complete mould grid system for precise component placement and alignment verification during blade assembly.

Ply Markers

Start and end markers for composite ply placement, ensuring accurate layup according to engineering specifications.

Rib Positioning

Precise markers for internal rib positioning within blade shells, critical for structural integrity and performance.

Resin Tube Positioning

Accurate placement markers for resin infusion tube positioning, ensuring optimal resin flow during manufacturing.

Root Fitting Circularity

Circular hologram projections for checking root fitting circularity and dimensional accuracy.

Defect Types Detected

Wrinkles

Detection and measurement of fabric wrinkles in composite layers, with automatic severity assessment.

Delamination

Identification of layer separation issues with precise boundary mapping and depth analysis.

Foreign Inclusions

Detection of foreign objects or materials within the composite structure.

Surface Defects

Comprehensive surface quality analysis including scratches, dents, and coating irregularities.

Quality Control Benefits

  • Eliminates measurement errors from manual tools
  • Provides consistent assessment criteria across factories
  • Streamlines complex repair handovers to engineering teams
  • Creates centralized repository for trend analysis
  • Supports root-cause investigations with historical data
  • Reduces cycle times and improves manufacturing efficiency

7. Troubleshooting

Common Issues and Solutions

AR Tracking Problems

⚠️

Issue: AR tracking fails or becomes unstable

  • Ensure adequate lighting (≥ 600 lux recommended)
  • Check for reflective surfaces that may interfere with tracking
  • Restart the AR session if tracking becomes inconsistent
  • Verify that the origin was placed correctly at the blade root

Marker Placement Issues

⚠️

Issue: Markers not placing correctly or appearing in wrong locations

  • Ensure markers are placed "inside" the shell (forward from origin)
  • For Two Points Mode, aim at corner edges (H-points) for best results
  • Check that surface tracking is active before placing markers
  • Move markers if lay-up or repair views show errors

Edge Mode Limitations

⚡

Known Issue: Edge Mode may fail to locate surfaces

  • Edge Mode is experimental - use Two Points Mode for critical inspections
  • If Edge Mode fails, switch to Two Points Mode for reliable placement
  • Report Edge Mode issues to support for future improvements

Y-Axis Movement Issues

⚠️

Known Limitation: Y-axis movement may lift markers above surface

  • Avoid moving markers along Y-axis when possible
  • Use X and Z axis adjustments for most positioning needs
  • This limitation is scheduled for correction in future updates

Best Practices

💡

For Optimal Performance:

  • • Maintain consistent lighting conditions throughout inspection
  • • Place origin accurately at blade root before starting
  • • Only the latest session can be resumed - delete older sessions
  • • Position origin at or beyond blade root for correct spatial references
  • • Use Two Points Mode for critical measurements
  • • Take multiple photos of each defect from different angles

System Requirements

Lighting: Minimum 600 lux for reliable AR tracking
Device: Modern smartphone with ARKit/ARCore support
Space: Clear workspace inside blade shell for movement
Network: Stable connection for real-time data streaming
